All the Bugs

View all insects in this app at once

An unfiltered list of all the insects on this app
  • Parasitic Wasp (predators)

    These tiny, non-stinging wasps are some of the most beneficial insects in the garden.

  • Mantis (predators)

    Mantises have triangular heads with bulging eyes supported on flexible necks

  • butterflies (pollinators)

    Adult butterflies have large, often brightly coloured wings, and conspicuous, fluttering flight.

  • Bee (pollinators)

    Bees are flying insects closely related to wasps and ants, known for their role in pollination

  • Blister Beetle (flying-pests)

    Blister beetles are a common field and garden pest best known for the welt-raising secretion they release when injured or crushed.

  • Asparagus Beetle (flying-pests)

    The common asparagus beetle, are pests of asparagus.

  • Cabbage Worms (crawling-pests)

    This is a common pest for cabbage, kale, cauliflower, broccoli, and other members of the cabbage vegetable family.

  • Aphids (crawling-pests)

    Tiny, pear shaped, soft bodied insects up to 1/8" long.
